taskDescription: Allene, H2C = \text{=}C = \text{=}CH2, has a heat of hydrogenation of –298 kJ/mol (–71.3 kcal/mol). Rank a conjugated diene, a nonconjugated diene, and an allene in order of stability.
detailedSolution: Expected ΔH°hydrog for allene is −252 kJ/mol. Allene is less stable than a nonconjugated diene, which is less stable than a conjugated diene.
